p: The yield of A. rosaeodora essential oil obtained from dried leaves thin branches was 2.8%. The oil showed a yellow color and a clean appearance ( Figure 1B), and presented a density of 0.89 g/mL at 25 °C, and a refractive index (ND 25) of 1.459. It was soluble in ethanol 70% in a ratio of 1:2. Chemical compounds identified and quantified in A. rosaeodora essential oil are presented in the chromatogram ( Figure 2) and Table 1. Three compounds were identified and enumerated accordingly with elution order and retention time. The major constituent of A. rosaeodora essential oil was linalool with 93.60%. In addition, α-terpinolene and linalool cis-oxide were identified and quantified at 3.37% and 3.03%, respectively.
